title: datalad copy-file error on systems without root access: "git -c diff.ignoreSubmodules=none annex ..."
body:
#### What is the problem?

I get a very cryptic error with `datalad copy-file`:

```
datalad copy-file -r annotation_derivatives/sub* .
```

> CommandError: 'git -c diff.ignoreSubmodules=none annex fromkey SHA256E-s5--082ff8d2e713588658e9e3b7cd232b9f40bb3c34c15f4e84e4a744c476177086.txt /home/appelhoff/appelhoff/testing/mpib_sp_eeg/derivatives/sub-01/sub-01_concat_eeg-excluded-ica-comps.txt --force --json --json-error-messages -c annex.dotfiles=true -c annex.retry=3' failed with exitcode 1 under /vol2/appelhoff/testing/mpib_sp_eeg
git-annex: fromkey: 1 failed

Can somebody help me figure this out? Is this a setup issue or a datalad problem?


#### What steps will reproduce the problem?

1. install git-annex via `conda` in a conda environment, and datalad via pip in a conda environment
1. `datalad clone https://gin.g-node.org/sappelhoff/mpib_sp_eeg/`
2. cd `mpib_sp_eeg`
3. here I am not sure: I ran `datalad get .` and that took a while. For reproducing my issue, `datalad get ./derivatives` may be enough, in order not to download a lot of data
4. from the dataset root, run `datalad copy-file -r ./derivatives/annotation_derivatives/sub* ./derivatives`

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?

- `0.14.4`
- for WTF click on details below:

#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?

This is happening on a server at my institute into which I am logged in via ssh. I have no sudo rights there.

The same workflow (`datalad copy-file ...`) worked well on my local machine.

#### Have you had any success using DataLad before? (to assess your expertise/prior luck.  We would welcome your testimonial additions to https://github.com/datalad/datalad/wiki/Testimonials as well)

Yes, DataLad is very nice and I appreciate the handbook. Uploading data to Gin worked nicely, and datalad allows me to mirror data I have on OSF to GitHub ... it's super handy to install just single files to be used e.g., in CI testing.

Thanks a lot!
